data.title: 1993 Hank Williams, Jr. Out of Left Field
data.meta_description:
What did everyone think of this album?  No macho songs, no redneck songs, no "I'm Hank Jr" songs, no arena rock songs, just Hank Jr. singing.    

[IMG]
data.text:
I remember when this was released I was very excited to see that Hank Jr. had signed with the resurrected Capricorn Records. It seemed like a natural fit for him. I remember being disappointed when I first bought this. Seemed way too mellow and laid back. The album has grown on me since then. I really like the covers of old soul numbers like the title track and Joe Tex's "Hold What You've Got". A couple of other standouts for me are "Everything Comes Down To Money And Love" and the humorous "I'm Tired".

On the other side of the coin the 2 big duds for me are "Diamond Mine" and "Blue Lady In The Red Mercedes".

This album follows the pattern that Bocephus has pretty much followed for the last 3 decades. A few very good songs, some ok filler and some real crap. For the hardcore fans (of which I count myself) mostly. If you wanted to introduce a newcomer to his music this album wouldn't be a good starting place.

Hank hasn't done his legacy any favors by releasing these half baked albums over the years. As was stated, there really isn't any of the self-referential bluster (that has been done to death) on this album. And that's a good thing in my book.

The best album Hank Jr. has released since the late 80's is IMHO "The Almeria Club". A very strong record that unfortunately kind of came and went without much notice.

Agree! 'The Almeria Club' is probably his last great album. I do like 'I'm One Of You', some great songs on that and

I played that and Almeria to death at the time.

The last 3 albums however are just one blur of winging and whining and it gets a bit old after a couple of songs.

I've bought them, and really have tried to like them being a Hank Jr fan, but I'm left with 'meh',

'here he goes again'..... rant rant rant....

You could probably take the last 3 albums and make one good actually.

One of the better tunes, I wish he'd get back to this type of stuff:
